Build a Bot: Engineering Creativity

This competition challenges participants to showcase their creativity and engineering skills by building a unique, independently standing robot.

About the Event

The event will test your innovation in design and your ability to use limited resources effectively.

Event Details

Team Size:

Teams of 3 members

Materials Provided:

Old newspapers, scissors, a stapler, and glue.

Time Limit:

1 hour 15 minutes to complete the robot structure.

Robot Requirements:

The robot must be freestanding without external support, showcasing originality and stability.

Team Limit:

A maximum of 2 teams from each college is allowed to participate.

Rules & Regulations

  • Each team must consist of exactly 3 members.
  • Only the materials provided (old newspapers, scissors, stapler, and glue) may be used to construct the robot.
  • Teams will have 1 hour 15 minutes to complete their robot structure.
  • The robot must stand independently without any external support.
  • Teams are encouraged to think outside the box and create unique, innovative designs.

Judging Criteria

  • Stability: The robot must be able to stand on its own without support.
  • Creativity and Originality: The design should be unique and innovative.
  • Aesthetic Appeal: The overall look and structure of the robot will be evaluated.
  • Teamwork and Explanation: Effective teamwork and clarity in explaining the design and functionality.
  • Judges' Decision: Judgesâ€™ decisions will be final and based on the above criteria.
